intro: Pelargonium geifolium, commonly known as the Cape marigold, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow to orange flowers. The plant has palmate leaves with lobed edges, and it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in sunny conditions. Pelargonium geifolium is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional African medicine.
